lines.text: She's like an ornery heifer sometimes, hard to hold down.
Sometimes it seems the more I know about women the less I know about women.
You know when I was a young man and in love, Sunday was a good day for swooning.
The truth shouldn't scare anybody, man or boy.
Look, mom, why don't you close the store and marry Don Brent?
You do more than talk things over, you come back here a bride. We don't want any dead ducks in the family.
Don't put such a high price on courage, it's an over-rated virtue.
Sometimes we figure too much son, the wrong things. Things that can never be figured. Then it's bad, bad for everyone.

[to Ellen]
There's a curse on those woods.
There's some connection between Pete's red house and whoever hit me.
I thought Pete told you not to go in those woods.
Ok, Sunday we'll go prowling.
I found an old trail, maybe it leads somewhere.
You're on my time now, or had you forgotten we had a date to go swimming this afternoon.
There's one thing you gotta do for me, stay outta those woods.
I don't care what Pete said, I wish we were prowling in the woods today.
I wanna clear out these hills when I get married.
Since when?
Since now.
I like the ground around here and I'd just as soon keep my feet on it.
Do you think there's a man on earth without something to conceal.
Go and stick your head under a faucet and cool off Tibby.
Meg needs to be with young people like Nath. You can't condemn her to loneliness.
Whatever happines I get I've got to find while I live.
You can get happiness by giving it.
As long as the Red House stands in the quarry my whole life is Meg's and her whole life is mine.
She's sleeping awfully sound... she's dead.
Hi, what you got on your mind... me?
I couldn't get you otta my mind baby.
That's the way I was made too.
She hurt bad?
She's dead.
You defied the woods and you were hurt. She defied them, and now she's dead.
Everything I love... dies.
Then you did kill her?
No, it was an accident, I was just trying to keep her quiet.
I picked up the whip and beat him till he wasn't handsome anymore, till he was dead, finished.
Stop that crying, stop it!
I thought I better finish what Ellen set out to do sweetheart. I set fire to the red house. Looking forwards is much better than looking back.
Tibby, you've got Meg all wrong, didn't she ask you out to spend the day and have dinner?
Yeah, but why?
Can't anybody do anything without you figuring they've got an angle?
I'VE always got an angle...

[ogling her]
You're growing up, Tibby. You're almost a woman.
Almost? I'm woman enough already.

[laughs]
I wouldn't say that.
Oh, what do you know about anything? You never got past the ninth grade.

[suggestively]
I'm doin' plenty of things... things they don't teach in school.

[to Tibby]
You can fool aroud with pretty boy Storm as much as you like, but when you decid on a real man, you come to me.

[to Teller]
There's no beter way to enforce a 'no trespassing" sign than a bullet missng somebody's skull.
